--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "petar_chervenski" <petar_chervenski@...> 
wro=
te:
> - My current experiments with ActiveVision show that it is hard to 
>=
 evolve substrates that recognize simple shapes that are randomly 
> rotate=
d. Perhaps I should tweak the NEAT parameters or the set of 
> activation f=
unctions? 
> 

Peter, in the experiment you are describing, are you using a=
 roving eye 
or just inputting a whole image into the substrate?  With Hype=
rNEAT, it 
should be possible to do recognition tasks without needing a rov=
ing eye.

In any case, I believe rotational invariance is indeed an activat=
ion 
function issue.  The problem is that you need to get the same pattern =

of connects repeated in a rotating fashion, so that they can recognize 
ro=
tated images.  This kind of rotation is not a very natural byproduct 
of th=
e usual set of activation functions.  I believe there is probably 
a rotati=
onal activation function that would be quite helpful, but I 
have not resol=
ved what function that should be.

ken
